channel.title: Programming on Bits and pieces to remember
channel.description: Recent content in Programming on Bits and pieces to remember

item.title: Distributed Patterns in Ruby
item.author: roman.heinrich@gmail.com
item.description: Interesting presentation, that explains the difficulties about distributing data between several nodes. Riak algorithms explained with Ruby code. $ git clone https://github.com/coderoshi/dds.git

item.title: Learn Rack API By Example
item.author: roman.heinrich@gmail.com
item.description: Learn Rack API by studying following libraries: http://github.com/soveran/cuba.git http://github.com/citrusbyte/cuba-app.git http://github.com/espresso/espresso http://github.com/sickill/example-rack-framework.git http://github.com/mtodd/fuck.git http://github.com/intridea/grape.git http://github.com/joshbuddy/http_router.git http://github.com/ivanvc/lunetas.git http://github.com/hassox/pancake.git http://github.com/fnando/rack-api.git http://github.com/bparanj/Rack-Developer-s-Notebook-Source-Code.git http://github.com/josh/rack-mount.git http://github.com/renee-project/renee.git http://github.com/stjohncj/RESTRack.git http://github.com/madx/roy.git http://github.com/godfat/ruby-server-exp.git http://github.com/bry4n/simple.git http://github.com/sinatra/sinatra.git http://github.com/mindreframer/sinatra-bootstrap.git http://github.com/zhengjia/sinatra-explained.git http://github.com/mwunsch/weary.git http://github.com/DAddYE/web-frameworks-benchmark.git http://github.com/zh/yarf.git

item.title: Git Subtree Testing
item.author: roman.heinrich@gmail.com
item.description: The problem http://git.661346.n2.nabble.com/organizing-multiple-repositories-with-dependencies-td7469712.html Git subtree https://github.com/apenwarr/git-subtree http://code.dimilow.com/git-subtree-notes-and-workflows/ http://www.featurist.co.uk/blog/2012/10/08/git-subtree/ http://endot.org/2012/02/12/git-subtree-tracking-made-easy/ https://github.com/ande3577/Git-Subtree-Workflow-Proposal/wiki/Subtree-Based-Workflow https://github.com/ande3577/Git-Subtree-Workflow-Proposal/wiki/Why%20Use%20Subtree http://log.pardus.de/2012/08/modular-git-with-git-subtree.html http://www.perforce.com/blog/121025/managing-projects-across-git-repositories https://github.com/projecthydra/hydrangea/blob/master/README_SUBTREE.textile http://ruleant.blogspot.com/2011/04/git-subtree-module.html http://somethingsinistral.net/blog/git-submodules-are-probably-not-the-answer/ https://www.acquia.com/blog/using-git-subtree-make-distro-your-docroot Install $ cd /tmp $ git clone git://github.com/apenwarr/git-subtree.git $ cd git-subtree $ (sudo) bash install.sh More stuff https://github.com/camptocamp/puppet-git-subtree https://rubygems.org/gems/thor_subtree http://endot.org/2012/02/12/git-subtree-tracking-made-easy/ Alternatives (http://stackoverflow.com/questions/6500524/git-subtree-or-gitslave-if-switch-away-from-git-submodules) : Repo : https://source.android.com/source/downloading.html Modman: modman - Module Manager https://github.com/jreinke/modgit https://github.com/rjocoleman/modgit/tree/subtree (with subtree as backend) https://github.

item.title: Presentation Software For Hackers
item.author: roman.heinrich@gmail.com
item.description: Presentation Software RevealJS - best! Ruby Showoff ShowOff is a Sinatra web app that reads simple configuration files for a presentation. It is sort of like a Keynote web app engine - think S5 + Slidedown. I am using it to do all my talks in 2010, because I have a deep hatred in my heart for Keynote and yet it is by far the best in the field.
